Articles.Content:
No Easter egg hunt challenge a day before Easter? SHAMEFUL DISPLAY!

The goal is to find as many Easter eggs as you can! A few rules:

1.The KSC monolith does not count--it's too easy to find!

2.You may not use any sort of map or other help, in-game or otherwise--find them the old-fashioned way!

3.Mods are allowed, but no cheaty stuff (Hyeredit, cheat menu, etc). MJ is allowed.

4.In case of dispute, I have final word on what counts as an Easter egg unless the devs speak up.

As for scoring:

Each Easter egg is worth 10 points, with and extra +5 if it is far from Kerbin.

'Missing' Easter eggs (Magic Boulder, Carl Sagan's face, etc.) are worth double.

Previously unknown Easter eggs (it's certainly possible!) are worth triple. You must prove this!

Begin!
Wasn't the magic boulder removed as well as Carl Sagan's face?

Wasn't the magic boulder removed as well as Carl Sagan's face?

The point being, if you can find them, you are awesome!
I think I'd better disqualify myself before I start: I've spent the past month or so playing with SCANSat maps and verifying against other sources.

I think I'd better disqualify myself before I start: I've spent the past month or so playing with SCANSat maps and verifying against other sources.

But can you land at their locations purely by memory? And what if there are Easter eggs that aren't included because no one knows about them?

But can you land at their locations purely by memory? And what if there are Easter eggs that aren't included because no one knows about them?

If you can land at them purely by memory, why would you need MJ? Besides, it's all online. You could just look up the coords, plug 'em into MJ and go grab a sandwich.

If you can land at them purely by memory, why would you need MJ? Besides, it's all online. You could just look up the coords, plug 'em into MJ and go grab a sandwich.

I thought I banned that.

I thought I banned that.

Oh. I thought it only said "ingame". Sorry! But if you happen to have a good memory and remember the coordinates (say, from a base near the Armstrong monument maybe?), would that count as cheating?

Oh. I thought it only said "ingame". Sorry! But if you happen to have a good memory and remember the coordinates (say, from a base near the Armstrong monument maybe?), would that count as cheating?

I'll decide that case-by-case.

I'm going to have a go at this now. Perfect way to test my Pegasus for SSLR.

Also, does the island count as an easter egg? If so, I'm going to leave that one behind.

B11267. Impersonating Rune is fun.
I may get Jeb to go 88 m/s to travel back to a previous release to find easter eggs that were taken out
